name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
eligibility: Small and marginal farmer families who own cultivable land as per land records of the respective State or Union Territory.
benefits: Income support of ₹6,000 per year per family, payable in three equal instalments.

name: Ayushman Bharat – Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
eligibility: Poor and vulnerable families identified based on the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) database.
benefits: Health insurance cover of up to ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalisation.

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
eligibility: All farmers including tenant farmers and sharecroppers growing notified crops in notified areas.
benefits: Insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in the event of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests and diseases.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana – Gramin (PMAY-G)
eligibility: Rural households identified as houseless or living in kutcha or dilapidated houses as per SECC data and Gram Sabha verification.
benefits: Financial assistance for construction of a pucca house with basic amenities in rural areas.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY)
eligibility: Individuals aged 18 to 50 years having a bank or post office account and who consent to auto-debit.
benefits: Life insurance cover of ₹2 lakh in case of death due to any reason.

name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY)
eligibility: Individuals aged 18 to 70 years having a bank or post office account and who consent to auto-debit.
benefits: Accidental death and disability insurance cover of ₹2 lakh for death or permanent total disability and ₹1 lakh for partial disability.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana – Urban (PMAY-U)
eligibility: Economically Weaker Section (EWS), Low Income Group (LIG) and Middle Income Group (MIG) households in urban areas who do not own a pucca house.
benefits: Assistance for housing through credit-linked subsidy and support for construction or purchase of houses in urban areas.

name: National Urban Livelihoods Mission (NULM)
eligibility: Urban poor including street vendors, homeless persons and members of self-help groups.
benefits: Skill training, employment support and assistance for self-employment and entrepreneurship for the urban poor.
